title: Nike's House of Hoops Logo
content:
[Image of store front](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202054638/http:/www.freshnessmag.com/v4/wp-gallery/nov_07/house_of_hoops/house-of-hoops-harlem.jpg)

Anyone know what font (modified as it may be) is used in the logo here? Or perhaps any type that is similar?

 [‹ (x) hand written script on Neil Young albums - custom font {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202054638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40143 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Slightly rounded sans from PC - Calibri {Adriano E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202054638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39967 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dontbugme

comments.content: Fiddle. I read above instead of below!! I’ve been robbed!
More likely than not, this is a custom job by Non-Format. A recent issue of IdN magazine had some photos of in-store work they’ve done for the same client.
If it is, then Giza is a possible alternative.
